definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: But is is just hypocrisy clearly, but foolishly think you love me.

sentences.english: The amateur singer is reluctant to cheat the audience by lip-synching with a false display of affectation。

sentences.english: She was the falsest woman that ever broke man's heartstrings .

sentences.english: Don't be a suck-up and be phony to your teacher.

sentences.english: The stockmarket had called the government’s bluff.

definition: graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
to have an axe to grind (idiom)
